pros: Caring Many coworkers demonstrate teamwork Not as stressful as fast food
cons: You have be careful since you work at the hospital (viral sickness, etc.)

pros: Lot’s of hours if you want them.
cons:
Toxic work environment, department managers are not business educated so they lack professionalism. Can be unsafe at times for females depending on unit culture, very old school mind-set still.
Nurses are intimidating to new staff and push them out due to, again - toxic work environment - don’t complain either because you will be bullied even more. Occ Health is their own type of army as well and there is no employee privacy between managers. Work in another city!

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Kingston, ON
pros: The other nurses are compassionate and great with patients
cons: Very top heavy organization. Lots of distrust from high mgmt. Poor communication from mgmt. Its a very disorganized organization that cares more about "how it looks" than how it actually feels to works as a employee there. Majority of the public have no idea how unsafe it is to work there and be a patient there. They are chronically understaffed and force you to work in environments that are unsafe and toxic. When something does happen mgmt is dismissive and unsupportive. Terrible place to work.

cons: workload versus staffing resources to complete work

cons: Poor incentives for growth .

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Kingston, ON
pros: Promotes a strong teamwork based environment. Everyone is very friendly. Deeply cares about their patients. Unit staff are very welcoming of new people. Compensation is through Union pay tables.
cons: No attempts at retention by administration. Limited educational opportunities. Feels like management is actively trying to promote poor morale. Senior administration out of touch with ground level staff.

pros:
Professional kind and smart staff
Growth opportunities
cons: Underground parking can be expensive

pros: Easy, straightforward work. Microwave stuff.
cons: 4 hour shifts, working mostly evenings and weekends.

pros: High quality academic, teaching centre
cons: Dated charting system, and informatics

pros: Nice, fun, happy, intersting, kind
cons: This place is not bad

pros: It says there's a 5 word minimum so here it is
cons:
Did not appreciate upper or lower management not being in tune with staffs' needs. Understaffing, poor work conditions, poor morale. Everyone seemed very burned out. No opportunities for growth (ie, full-time, permanent) in a department I was interested in.
As an aside: dirty facility. At least keep the coffee open for overnight staff??

pros: KGH is a wonderful place that is on the cutting edge of medicine, technology, and all healthcare disciplines. The people who work here are extremely kind and caring, and truly wish to see our patients do well and thrive. It is an egalitarian workplace that is fair and committed its patients, staff, visitors, and our community. I am proud to be part of this fantastic organization!
cons: Honestly, the cons are relatively minor, and comparable to all healthcare organizations. The parking is difficult. For the staff, our leaders have tried their best to accommodate this by being fair about the spaces available, and provide transport to and from large parking lots outside KGH. The prices are low, and the buses are frequent. KGH has also worked with the city to provide several routes of express buses so that parking costs are minimal. I appreciate this.

pros:
I'm full time at the Auxiliary Cafe on Davis 1. I've been there for over 20 years and love my job. I love to make people smile. I love to make customers feel like they're the most important part of my day, and they are!
Everyone is part of a team and we all work as a team. I love the regulars, who know they don't even have to ask for their order, we just know.
I like to help out the patients who don't want hospital food, so come to the Cafe for a hot sandwich and soup.
Sometimes its just ok to listen to the customer when they tell you how bad their day is and offer a kind word.
We're a big family and we will always offer our service with a great big smile!!
cons: The only downside is parking for staff at KGH.

pros: The pay is great... there are often opportunities to explore other careers within the hospital.
cons:
Thanks to Compass, hours are cut... and everyone is expected to do more than they are able. Patients suffer as a result of employees not having the time to do a good job. 
(meal orders aren't taken, things are not cleaned properly...)

pros: Some great wards. Pediatrics teams, ICU can be great. Newly renovated wards in Psychiatry and Pediatrics. Lots of comraderie among fellow residents.
cons: The rest of the hospital can be a crumbling dump. Paint peeling off walls in the stairwells, old and smelly carpeting on the wards, and frequently gridlocked bed situations can be stressful

pros: Wonderful people at the Cancer Center of Southeastern Ontario doing meaningful research in medical imaging and cancer therapy. The medical physicists are smart, helpful, and provide great mentorship.
cons: Since I was conducting research in a clinical environment the physicists were often very busy. You need to be a self-starter who can manage their own time. The onus on getting journal articles published is on the researcher/student.

review_title: Non supportive of administrative.  Nurses I worked with were wonderful
pros: Union, pay and the people you work with.
cons: Non supportive upper management.  If asked to work overtime, very little compensation.  Great people to work with

pros: Enjoyed the camaraderie between the ER nurses
